title: The Purpose of the Varnashrama System in Society | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | SB 4.14.18 | 16.07.2024
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.text: The king is supposed to be pious in whose state and cities the general population strictly observes
the system of eight social orders of Varna and Ashrama
and where all citizens engage in worshipping the Supreme Personality of Godhead by their particular occupation.
The state's duty and the citizens' duty are very nicely explained in this verse.
The activities of the government head or king as well as the activities of the citizens
must be so directed that ultimately everyone engages in devotional service to the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
The king or the government head is supposed to be representative of the Supreme Personality of Godhead
and is therefore supposed to see that things are so go on nicely
and the citizens situated in the scientific social order comprise four Ashramas, four Varnas and four Ashramas.
In the Vishnu Purana, it is stated that unless people are educated or situated in the scientific social order comprised of four Varnas,
then four Ashramas, Brahmana, Grahastha, Vanaprastha, Brahmacharya, Grahastha, Vanaprastha and Sannyasa.
Society can never be considered real human society
nor can it make any advancement towards the ultimate goal of human life.
It is the duty of the government to see that things go on in terms of Varna and Ashrama.
As stated here in Bhagavan Etnapurusha,
the Supreme Personality of Godhead Krishna is the Etnapurusha.
As stated in Bhagavad Gita, Bhaktaram, Yajna Tapasam,
Krishna is the ultimate purpose of all sacrifice.
He is also the enjoyer of all sacrifices.
Therefore, he is known as Etnapurusha.
The word Etnapurusha indicates Lord Vishnu or Lord Krishna or any personality of Godhead
in the category of Vishnu Tattva.
people are situated in the orders of Godhead.
They follow the orders of Varna and Ashrama
and are engaged in worshipping Lord Vishnu by their respective activities.
Every citizen engaged in an occupation renders service by the resultant actions of his activities.
That is the perfection of life.
yatah pravrttir bhuthanam ena sarvam idam tatam
By worship of the Lord, who is the source of all beings and who is all-pervading,
man can, in the performance of his own duty, attain perfection.
Thus, the Brahmana Kshatriya Vaishya Shudras must execute their prescribed duties
as these duties are stated in the Shastras.
In this way, everyone can satisfy the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Vishnu.
The king or the government head has to see that the citizens are thus engaged.
In other words, the state or the government must not deviate from its duty
by declaring that state is a secular state,
which has no interest in whether or not the people advance in Varna Ashrama.

and people who rule over the citizens have no respect for Varna Ashrama Dharma.
